value:
It has been a long time since I left
my country...$k$pAnd now, I take to the field of battle
once again... Yes, that idea sits well
with me.

Gallia has no shortage of brave
warriors eager for a fight. But will
they ever reach their potential?$k$pCourage and strength alone are not
enough. Knowledge is required. I can
only hope they heed my words.

Exhausted already? You may be a
leader, but you're still green.$k$pOh, don't worry. The fact that I gripe
means I consider you worthy of
hearing it.

You...probably shouldn't touch me.
My hair is very coarse. You might
get poked right back.

Do you need something? I was just
taking a good, long look around.$k$pAt first glance, life here seems similar
to what I know, but the differences
are substantial, aren't they?

I was asked to look after you
by $Nf.
I'll gladly lend you my strength.

My strength is returning... Just like
the old days, when I'd dash across
the battlefield, bursting with energy.

What a fine thing, having room
to grow.

Hmmm. Well, don't be concerned.
When it counts, I'll demonstrate my
worth.

Ideals alone can't protect my citizens.
With this, I can at least reduce the
casualties on our side.

I am Caineghis of Gallia, known
as the Lion King. I will lend my
strength to your ambitions.

This country's history is fascinating.
It teaches a very different lesson than
Gallia's.$k$pPerhaps I'm showing my age by
saying this, but it feels wonderful to
know I still have things to learn...$k$pCourage, of itself, is not power.
Knowledge can be sharper than a
sword.$k$pAs long as you live, you should
continue to fight, and you should
always learn.$k$pLet us both aim to improve ourselves,
$Nu.$k$pIf that is your goal, I will spare no
effort to help you realize it. Two of
the same mind, fighting with pride.
はぁっ！
むん！
ぐぬぅっ！
This wound...
Hyaaagh!
You will not win this.
I protect my allies!
This old blood still boils.
Age has caught up with me...
Sigh
I am Caineghis, King of Gallia and the beast tribe.
Your country's greetings are strange to me.
We laguz need no weapons but our bodies.
I have met a fair number of trustworthy beorc.
Like many others, my youth was hot-blooded and full of battle.
In the peaceful world I hope for, the only battles are controlled matches, with all the little rules they have.
You must survive. The beorc and the laguz rely on you.
*grunt*
Goddess bless my steps.
Let's be on our way.
